name: Andromeda
description: The Chained Maiden. Home to our nearest galaxy neighbor.

name: Luchtpomp
description: The Air Pump. A faint southern constellation.

name: Paradijsvogel
description: The Bird of Paradise. Near the south celestial pole.

name: Waterman
description: The Water Bearer. A large zodiac constellation.

name: Arend
description: The Eagle. Contains Altair, part of the Summer Triangle.

name: Altaar
description: The Altar. Located between Scorpius and Triangulum Australe.

name: Ram
description: The Ram. The first sign of the zodiac.

name: Voerman
description: The Charioteer. Contains the bright star Capella.

name: Ossenhoeder
description: The Herdsman. Contains Arcturus, a very bright orange giant.

name: Graveerstift
description: The Chisel. A faint constellation in the southern sky.

name: Giraffe
description: The Giraffe. A large, faint northern constellation.

name: Kreeft
description: The Crab. Faint zodiac sign, home to the Beehive Cluster.

name: Jachthonden
description: The Hunting Dogs. Pursuing the Great Bear.

name: Grote Hond
description: The Great Dog. Contains Sirius, the brightest star in the sky.

name: Kleine Hond
description: The Lesser Dog. Contains the bright star Procyon.

name: Steenbok
description: The Sea Goat. The smallest constellation of the zodiac.

name: Kiel
description: The Keel. Part of the ship Argo Navis; contains Canopus.

name: Cassiopeia
description: The Queen. Famous for its W-shape in the northern sky.

name: Centaur
description: The Centaur. Contains our closest star neighbor, Alpha Centauri.

name: Cepheus
description: The King. Shaped like a house, near the north pole.

name: Walvis
description: The Sea Monster. Fourth largest constellation.

name: Kameleon
description: The Chameleon. A small constellation near the south pole.

name: Passer
description: The Compass. Defines the shape of a drafting tool.

name: Duif
description: The Dove. Represents Noah's dove.

name: Hoofdhaar
description: Berenice's Hair. Only constellation named after a historical figure.

name: Zuiderkroon
description: The Southern Crown. A distinctive wreath shape.

name: Noorderkroon
description: The Northern Crown. A small, clear semi-circle.

name: Raaf
description: The Crow. A small quadrilateral near Virgo.

name: Beker
description: The Cup. Represents the cup of Apollo.

name: Zuiderkruis
description: The Southern Cross. The smallest but one of the most famous constellations.

name: Zwaan
description: The Swan. Also known as the Northern Cross.

name: Dolfijn
description: The Dolphin. A small, diamond-shaped constellation.

name: Goudvis
description: The Dolphinfish. Contains most of the Large Magellanic Cloud.

name: Draak
description: The Dragon. Winds around the Little Bear.

name: Veulen
description: The Little Horse. The second smallest constellation.

name: Eridanus
description: The River. A long winding line of stars ending in Achernar.

name: Oven
description: The Furnace. Named after a chemical furnace.

name: Tweelingen
description: The Twins. Castor and Pollux are the main stars.

name: Kraanvogel
description: The Crane. A prominent southern bird.

name: Hercules
description: The Hero. Fifth largest constellation, contains M13 cluster.

name: Slingeruurwerk
description: The Pendulum Clock. A faint southern constellation.

name: Waterslang
description: The Water Snake. The largest of all 88 constellations.

name: Kleine Waterslang
description: The Male Water Snake. Near the Small Magellanic Cloud.

name: Indiër
description: The Indian. A southern constellation.

name: Hagedis
description: The Lizard. A zig-zag line of stars.

name: Leeuw
description: The Lion. Contains the bright star Regulus.

name: Kleine Leeuw
description: The Little Lion. Situated between Leo and Ursa Major.

name: Haas
description: The Hare. Being chased by Orion's dogs.

name: Weegschaal
description: The Scales. The only inanimate object in the zodiac.

name: Wolf
description: The Wolf. Victim of the Centaur.

name: Lynx
description: The Lynx. A faint line, requires 'lynx eyes' to see.

name: Lier
description: The Lyre. Home to Vega, one of the brightest stars.

name: Tafelberg
description: Table Mountain. The faintest of all constellations.

name: Microscoop
description: The Microscope. A faint southern constellation.

name: Eenhoorn
description: The Unicorn. Found inside the Winter Triangle.

name: Vlieg
description: The Fly. A small southern constellation.

name: Winkelhaak
description: The Level. Represents a carpenter's square.

name: Octant
description: The Octant. Contains the South Celestial Pole.

name: Slangendrager
description: The Serpent Bearer. The '13th' unofficial zodiac sign.

name: Orion
description: The Hunter. The most recognizable winter constellation.

name: Pauw
description: The Peacock. Known for its bright star Peacock.

name: Pegasus
description: The Winged Horse. Famous for the Great Square.

name: Perseus
description: The Hero. Contains the variable star Algol.

name: Phoenix
description: The Phoenix. A mythical firebird.

name: Schilderssezel
description: The Painter's Easel. A southern constellation.

name: Vissen
description: The Fishes. Two fish tied by a cord.

name: Zuidervis
description: The Southern Fish. Contains Fomalhaut.

name: Achtersteven
description: The Poop Deck. Largest part of the old Argo Navis.

name: Kompas
description: The Mariner's Compass. Part of the Argo Navis group.

name: Net
description: The Reticle. Represents the net in a telescope eyepiece.

name: Pijl
description: The Arrow. The third smallest constellation.

name: Boogschutter
description: The Archer. marks the center of the Milky Way.

name: Schorpioen
description: The Scorpion. Distinctive J-shape southern constellation.

name: Beeldhouwer
description: The Sculptor. Contains the South Galactic Pole.

name: Schild
description: The Shield. A small cloud of stars in the Milky Way.

name: Slang
description: The Serpent. The only constellation split in two parts.

name: Sextant
description: The Sextant. A faint equatorial constellation.

name: Stier
description: The Bull. Contains Aldebaran and the Pleiades.

name: Telescoop
description: The Telescope. A southern constellation.

name: Driehoek
description: The Triangle. Contains the Triangulum Galaxy (M33).

name: Zuiderdriehoek
description: The Southern Triangle. A distinct equilateral triangle.

name: Toekan
description: The Toucan. Home to the Small Magellanic Cloud.

name: Grote Beer
description: The Great Bear. Contains the Big Dipper.

name: Kleine Beer
description: The Little Bear. Contains Polaris, the North Star.

name: Zeilen
description: The Sails. Part of the Argo Navis ship.

name: Maagd
description: The Virgin. Second largest constellation, contains many galaxies.

name: Vliegende Vis
description: The Flying Fish. Represents a fish being chased.

name: Vosje
description: The Fox. Contains the Dumbbell Nebula.
